Articles.Content:
13 hours ago, Angel-125 said:

Odd that WBT won't load, can you try the latest from GitHub?

Ok - here's what I did:

  • Fresh clean install of KSP 1.11.2
  • Downloaded WildBlueTools from github - latest version - and installed it
  • Launched, checked logs - no errors other that complaining there was no Tweakscale module
  • Downloaded MOLE from github - latest version - and installed. Deleted the 000WildBlueTools folder and re-copied from the stand-alone download
  • Launched - loaded ~75 patches - can see the texture-switching functionality in afore-mentioned MOLE parts. However, I am seeing module-load errors:
    Spoiler

    [LOG 07:35:43.226] AssemblyLoader: Loading assemblies
    [ERR 07:35:43.299] ADDON BINDER: Cannot resolve assembly: WildBlueTools, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

    [ERR 07:35:43.299] ADDON BINDER: Cannot resolve assembly: WildBlueTools, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

    [ERR 07:35:43.304] AssemblyLoader: Exception loading 'MoleUtils': System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException: Exception of type 'System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException' was thrown.
      at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Reflection.Assembly.GetTypes(System.Reflection.Assembly,bool)
      at System.Reflection.Assembly.GetTypes () [0x00000] in <ad04dee02e7e4a85a1299c7ee81c79f6>:0 
      at AssemblyLoader.LoadAssemblies () [0x000e6] in <06f13185617646e5bc801baeab53ab75>:0 

    Additional information about this exception:

     System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'WildBlueTools, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies.
    File name: 'WildBlueTools, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'

     System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'WildBlueTools, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies.
    File name: 'WildBlueTools, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'

     System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'WildBlueTools, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies.
    File name: 'WildBlueTools, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'

    [LOG 07:35:43.314] VesselModules: Found VesselModule of type AxisGroupsModule with order 999

     

  • I did notice that MOLE was packaged with WBI Tools version 1.82.0, whereas the stand-alone WBI Tools that I downloaded was 1.82.1.

  • Replaced all WBI folders except MOLE folder with folders from WBI Tools - still getting above log errors but again, part-switching is working.

  • Re-copied fresh KSP install & installed MOLE via CKAN, along with dependencies. Selected WBI Simplified Play Mode in that selection screen. Only loaded 28 patches. No MOLE tab in VAB. Texture issue is back. Far more extensive error messages: 

    Spoiler

    [LOG 07:47:23.168] AssemblyLoader: Loading assemblies
    [ERR 07:47:23.239] ADDON BINDER: Cannot resolve assembly: WildBlueTools, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

    [ERR 07:47:23.239] ADDON BINDER: Cannot resolve assembly: WildBlueTools, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

    [ERR 07:47:23.244] AssemblyLoader: Exception loading 'MoleUtils': System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException: Exception of type 'System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException' was thrown.

      at System.Reflection.Assembly.GetTypes () [0x00000] in <ad04dee02e7e4a85a1299c7ee81c79f6>:0

    (Yes, the BARISBridge folder was present)

  • Finally, I replaced but the MOLE folder with the folders from the WBI Tools download (excluding Classic Stock Resources) & launched - issue resolved but am still seeing this in the log:

    Spoiler

    [LOG 07:58:36.119] AssemblyLoader: Loading assemblies
    [ERR 07:58:36.190] ADDON BINDER: Cannot resolve assembly: WildBlueTools, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

      at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Reflection.Assembly.GetTypes(System.Reflection.Assembly,bool)
      at System.Reflection.Assembly.GetTypes () [0x00000] in <ad04dee02e7e4a85a1299c7ee81c79f6>:0 
      at AssemblyLoader.LoadAssemblies () [0x000e6] in <06f13185617646e5bc801baeab53ab75>:0 

    Additional information about this exception:

    File name: 'WildBlueTools, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'

    [LOG 07:58:36.206] VesselModules: Found VesselModule of type AxisGroupsModule with order 999

    So - conclusion. Works if you download it from github, doesn't work with CKAN. 

Edited June 11, 2021 by Bombaatu

      Reveal hidden contents

    [LOG 07:58:36.119] AssemblyLoader: Loading assemblies
    [ERR 07:58:36.190] ADDON BINDER: Cannot resolve assembly: WildBlueTools, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

    [ERR 07:58:36.190] ADDON BINDER: Cannot resolve assembly: WildBlueTools, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

    [ERR 07:58:36.194] AssemblyLoader: Exception loading 'MoleUtils': System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException: Exception of type 'System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException' was thrown.
      at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Reflection.Assembly.GetTypes(System.Reflection.Assembly,bool)
      at System.Reflection.Assembly.GetTypes () [0x00000] in <ad04dee02e7e4a85a1299c7ee81c79f6>:0 
      at AssemblyLoader.LoadAssemblies () [0x000e6] in <06f13185617646e5bc801baeab53ab75>:0 

    Additional information about this exception:

     System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'WildBlueTools, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies.

    So - conclusion. Works if you download it from github, doesn't work with CKAN. 

It sounds like there is an issue with the CKAN config then. I'll definitely need help to fix that. CKAN should always pull the latest Wild Blue Tools. Thanks for investigating!
For what it's worth, I have it installed through CKAN with no issues, so I'm presuming this is something a little more complex. Maybe a corrupted cached download on their end?

Ok, @Angel-125 - there is still an issue and it's an incompatibility between latest MOLE & latest WildBlueTools. The issue may *not* be CKAN but rather this incompatibility. This is causing the MoleUtils to not load - it even becomes corrupted, from what I can see.

To test:

Fresh install. Download latest MOLE & WildBlueTools from github. Install all of the folders from MOLE & launch game. Go into VAB & pull up a MOLE. Right-click - note that the 'Manage Operations' and 'Start Lab Time' buttons are present - all good. 

Now, shut down & deletethe 000WildBlueTools folder, replacing it with the one from the one in WBITools 1.82.1. Launch & repeat test. Note the buttons are no longer present. Check the log & you will see that the MoleUtils.dll would not load. Here's the kicker - deleting the 000WildBlueTools folder & replacing it again with the one from MOLE 1.26.0 DOES NOT WORK - relaunch & you will see the same issue. The only recourse is to replace BOTH the 000WildBlueTools & MOLE folders. Once that is done, normal function is restored.

Hello, @Angel-125!  I installed MOLE and the MOLE CRP play mode through CKAN, and I noticed in the GameData\WildBlueIndustries\MOLE\ModuleManagerPatches folder, the RealPlume .cfg file is missing the period before the file extension; the filename is "MM_RealPlumecfg", as opposed to "MM_RealPlume.cfg".  I put the period in the filename in my local installation myself and restarted after deleting all the MM cache files and I haven't noticed any wonkiness yet, I just thought you might want to know.
